git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/71/217271/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * There should be at least one controller. The `Not enough deployed controllers` error occurs when you have 1 Controller installed and want to redeploy that controller. During redeployment, it will be taken off, so for some time the cluster will not have any operating controller, which is wrong. * If we are using simple multinode mode, then we cannot add more than one controller. * In HA mode, we can add as much as possible controllers, though it is recommended to add at least 3. #. Compute * It is recommended to have at least one compute in non-vCenter env (https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1381613: note that this is a bug in UI and not yaml-specific). Beginning with Fuel 6.1, no vCenter-related limitations are longer present. * Computes cannot be combined with controllers. * Computes cannot be added if vCenter is chosen as a hypervisor. * It is impossible to add Cinder nodes to an environment with Ceph RBD. * At least one Cinder node is recommended * Cinder LVM needs to be enabled on the *Settings* tab of the Fuel web UI. * Cannot be added to already deployed environment. * Can be added only if Ceilometer is enabled. * Cannot be combined with Ceph OSD and Compute. * For a simple mode there has to be 1 Mongo node, for HA at least 3. * It is not allowed to choose MongoDB role for a node if external MongoDB setup is used. * Only available in experimental ISO. * Cannot be combined with any other roles. * Only one Zabbix node can be assigned in an environment. * Cannot be used with Mongo and Zabbix. * Minimal number of Ceph nodes is equal to the `Ceph object replication factor` value from the *Settings* tab of the Fuel web UI. * Ceph cannot be added if vCenter is chosen as a hypervisor and `volumes_ceph`, `images_ceph` and `ephemeral_ceph` settings are all False. * Either a node with MongoDB role or external MongoDB turned on is required.
deleted_lines: * There should be at least one controller. The `Not enough deployed controllers` error occurs when you have 1 Controller installed and want to redeploy that controller. During redeployment, it will be taken off, so for some time the cluster will not have any operating controller, which is wrong. * If we are using simple multinode mode, then we cannot add more than one controller. * In HA mode, we can add as much as possible controllers, though it is recommended to add at least 3. #. Compute * It is recommended to have at least one compute in non-vCenter env (https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1381613 : note that this is a bug in UI and not yaml-specific). Beginning with Fuel 6.1, no vCenter-related limitations are longer present. * Computes cannot be combined with controllers. * Computes cannot be added if vCenter is chosen as a hypervisor * It is impossible to add Cinder nodes to an environment with Ceph RBD. * At least one Cinder node is recommended * Cinder LVM needs to be enabled on the *Settings* tab of the Fuel web UI * Cannot be added to already deployed environment. * Can be added only if Ceilometer is enabled. * Cannot be combined with Ceph OSD and Compute. * For a simple mode there has to be 1 Mongo node, for HA at least 3. * It is not allowed to choose MongoDB role for a node if external MongoDB setup is used. * Only available in experimental ISO. * Cannot be combined with any other roles. * Only one Zabbix node can be assigned in an environment. * Cannot be used with Mongo and Zabbix. * Minimal number of Ceph nodes is equal to the `Ceph object replication factor` value from the *Settings* tab of the Fuel web UI * Ceph cannot be added if vCenter is chosen as a hypervisor and `volumes_ceph`, `images_ceph` and `ephemeral_ceph` settings are all False * Either a node with MongoDB role or external MongoDB turned on is required .

commit_message:
Put configuration files under configurable folder

Instead of putting baremetal.json and groupvars/all on the
git repo folder for Bifrost, just create a folder (which defaults
to /etc/bifrost) and put those files in there.
This will avoid having a dirty bifrost git repo and having issues
whenever the Bifrost git repo is updated.
Note, you will need to run
'ansible-playbook -e @/etc/bifrost/bifrost_global_vars ...' in order
to load the configuration file variables at execution time.
Check http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/playbooks_variables.html for
more info.

Change-Id: Id0f5711f6f4e18cf67586e2445d8bd09c5db7ca9

Fixed test_password_prompted

test_password_prompted no longer makes DNS lookups on the network.

Closes-Bug: 1486647

commit_message:
Update response code to 204 for reactivate and deactivate image

Also, made a few small edits

Change-Id: I34105fbcf3ceee994751f6bc4b9b4b19d742ff5d
Closes-Bug: #1482101
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/api-site refs/changes/93/215793/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The request body must conform to one of these media types: application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch (Since Image API v2.2.) If you cannot update locations, your request might be missing some information. Make sure that you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, review your API request. The response body contains the raw binary data that represents the actual virtual disk. The Content-Type header contains the value application/octet-stream. The Content-MD5 header contains an MD5 checksum of the image data. Clients are encouraged to verify the integrity of the image data they receive by using this checksum. (Since Image API v2.2.)
deleted_lines: The request body must conform to one of the following media types: application/openstack-images-v2.0-json-patch application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch (Since Image API v2.2) If you cannot update locations, your request might be missing some information. Make sure that you meet the preconditions and run the request again. If the request fails again, review your API request. The Content-MD5 header contains an MD5 checksum of the image data. Clients are encouraged to verify the integrity of the image data they receive by using this checksum. (Since Image API 2.2.)

commit_message:
Remove XML samples for os-server-actions extensions

Also, remove them for os-availability-zone, os-config-drive,
os-flavor-access, os-flavor-manage, os-flavor-rxtx,
os-flavor-swap, os-server-list-multi-status extensions

Change-Id: I2249d6e785f5fede3f41547abbbe98b3942e5eba
Closes-Bug: #1486482

commit_message:
Create conf directory during devstack install phase

Otherwise other plugins which depend on ceilometer and want to set
configuration items may have issues with the configuration directory not
being there.

Change-Id: Id8d10c9fcdd85e2840a74dcff5245b6f44f7424b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/81/217081/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Unify Centos and Ubuntu Source Install - Neutron

A change merged in the base allows for Centos and Ubuntu to install
all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I5c61a31b0a6d8892350311b4afe8f31c28eb2f7f
Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/36/217836/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ADD neutron.tar / RUN ln -s /neutron-* neutron \ && pip --no-cache-dir install /neutron \ && chown -R neutron: /etc/neutron /usr/share/neutron /var/log/neutron /home/neutron
deleted_lines: ADD ./neutron.tar / RUN ln -s /neutron-* /neutron RUN cd /neutron \ && pip install -r requirements.txt \ && pip install --install-option="--install-scripts=/usr/bin" /neutron \ && chown -R neutron: /etc/neutron /var/log/neutron /home/neutron \ && rm -rf /root/.cache

commit_message:
Make logging more better

build.py logging has never done what people think it should do, this
patch aims to fix that. All logs related to an image will now be
printed with the image name prefixed to the message.

To acheive this we have to print out the messages as we get them, even
in parallel building mode. If you wish to view the logs for an single
image, a grep would be advised to filter the logs.

Change-Id: I15ae361892f06a47afafe73750ddd8628697cfea
Implements: blueprint build-script

Workflow API layer

added_lines: # Copyright 2015 - Rackspace US, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import pecan from pecan import rest import wsmeext.pecan as wsme_pecan from solum.api.controllers.v1.datamodel import workflow from solum.api.handlers import app_handler from solum.api.handlers import workflow_handler as wf_handler from solum.common import exception from solum.common import request from solum.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class WorkflowController(rest.RestController): """Manages operations on a single workflow.""" def __init__(self, app_id, wf_id): super(WorkflowController, self).__init__(self) self.app_id = app_id self.wf_id = wf_id @exception.wrap_pecan_controller_exception @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(workflow.Workflow) def get(self): """Return this workflow.""" request.check_request_for_https() # ahandler = app_handler.AppHandler(pecan.request.security_context) # app_model = ahandler.get(self.app_id) handler = wf_handler.WorkflowHandler(pecan.request.security_context) wf_model = handler.get(self.wf_id) wf_model = workflow.Workflow.from_db_model(wf_model, pecan.request.host_url) return wf_model class WorkflowsController(rest.RestController): """Manages operations on all of an app's workflows.""" def __init__(self, app_id): super(WorkflowsController, self).__init__(self) self.app_id = app_id @pecan.expose() def _lookup(self, wf_uuid, *remainder): if remainder and not remainder[-1]: remainder = remainder[:-1] return WorkflowController(self.app_id, wf_uuid), remainder @exception.wrap_pecan_controller_exception @wsme_pecan.wsexpose(workflow.Workflow, body=workflow.Workflow, status_code=200) def post(self, data): """Create a new workflow.""" request.check_request_for_https() if not data: raise exception.BadRequest(reason='No data.') ahandler = app_handler.AppHandler(pecan.request.security_context) app_model = ahandler.get(self.app_id) handler = wf_handler.WorkflowHandler(pecan.request.security_context) all_wfs = [workflow.Workflow.from_db_model(obj, pecan.request.host_url) for obj in handler.get_all(app_id=self.app_id)] data.app_id = app_model.id data.config = app_model.workflow_config data.source = app_model.source # TODO(datsun180b): Do this incrementing properly. # This isn't any kind of safe at all. # There isn't even a uniqueness constraint the table, # though there ought to be. data.wf_id = len(all_wfs) + 1 wf_data = data.as_dict(workflow.Workflow) return workflow.Workflow.from_db_model(handler.create(wf_data), pecan.request.host_url) @exception.wrap_pecan_controller_exception @wsme_pecan.wsexpose([workflow.Workflow]) def get_all(self): """Return all of one app's workflows, based on the query provided.""" request.check_request_for_https() # ahandler = app_handler.AppHandler(pecan.request.security_context) # app_model = ahandler.get(self.app_id) handler = wf_handler.WorkflowHandler(pecan.request.security_context) all_wfs = [workflow.Workflow.from_db_model(obj, pecan.request.host_url) for obj in handler.get_all(app_id=self.app_id)] return all_wfs

commit_message:
Javascript Heat API

This patch adds the start of a Javascript Heat API similar
to the rest of the existing OpenStack ones. The app-catalog
needs this to check if a given template will work on a
specific cloud.

Change-Id: I5c245614f747ade8a91a6ac73ca39c6f99ab54bf
Partial-Bug: 1481518

commit_message:
Fix for string type seg-id

Creating l2-gateway gives internal
server error if segmentation-id specified is
string type.

Change-Id: I64e9555ea1419e56ab1bde7c661d0551814f1952
Closes-bug: 1483130

commit_message:
Compute versions using setup.cfg, switch to .0rcX

Adapt version computation in rcdelivery.sh following the change
to different version numbers for each component and PEP440
.0rcX format.

Change-Id: I32d10f617a70ddafaf7645494f9d63acf723c33a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/release-tools refs/changes/56/217156/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: title "Cloning repository for $PROJECT" setup_temp_space rc-delivery-$PROJECT clone_repo openstack/$PROJECT stable/$SERIES cd openstack/$PROJECT title "Resolving $LPROJECT $SERIES $RC to version" FINALVERSION=`grep "^version = " setup.cfg | awk -F" " '{ print $3 }'` if [[ "$FINALVERSION" == "" ]]; then echo "Could not determine pre-version from setup.cfg" exit 1 fi VERSION="${FINALVERSION}.0${RC}"echo "${PROJECT^} $SERIES $RC (milestone $MILESTONE) is version $VERSION" if [[ "$VERSION" != "$FINALVERSION" ]]; then echo "Final $SERIES version will be $FINALVERSION" fi
deleted_lines: title "Resolving $LPROJECT $SERIES $RC to version" RC1VERSION=`$TOOLSDIR/ms2version.py $LPROJECT $SERIES-rc1` FINALVERSION=${RC1VERSION:0:8} VERSION=`$TOOLSDIR/ms2version.py $LPROJECT $MILESTONE` FINALVERSION=${VERSION:0:8}echo "$SERIES $RC (milestone $MILESTONE) is version $VERSION" echo "Final $SERIES version will be $FINALVERSION" title "Cloning repository for $PROJECT" setup_temp_space rc-delivery-$PROJECT clone_repo openstack/$PROJECT stable/$SERIES cd openstack/$PROJECT

The Monasca API spec supports multiple comma separated dimensions in the

commit_message:
Fix handling of mutiple dimensions in query

The Monasca API spec supports multiple comma separated dimensions in the
query string, however this was handled incorrectly (the Falcon library
parses this into a list, while the existing code was always expecting a
string.)

Additionally, the code was not handling the case of multiple instances
of the Dimensions query parameter.

Change-Id: Iebed15fed234b6052df899cbe84264e849f9895c

You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import falcon import monasca_api.v2.reference.helpers as helpers from mock import Mock import unittest class TestGetQueryDimension(unittest.TestCase): def test_no_dimensions(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = "foo=bar" result = helpers.get_query_dimensions(req) self.assertEqual(result, {}) def test_one_dimensions(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = "foo=bar&dimensions=Dimension:Value" result = helpers.get_query_dimensions(req) self.assertEqual(result, {"Dimension": "Value"}) def test_comma_sep_dimensions(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = ("foo=bar&" "dimensions=Dimension:Value,Dimension-2:Value-2") result = helpers.get_query_dimensions(req) self.assertEqual( result, {"Dimension": "Value", "Dimension-2": "Value-2"}) def test_multiple_dimension_params(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = ("foo=bar&" "dimensions=Dimension:Value&" "dimensions=Dimension-2:Value-2") result = helpers.get_query_dimensions(req) self.assertEqual( result, {"Dimension": "Value", "Dimension-2": "Value-2"}) def test_multiple_dimension_params_with_comma_sep_dimensions(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = ("foo=bar&" "dimensions=Dimension-3:Value-3&" "dimensions=Dimension:Value,Dimension-2:Value-2") result = helpers.get_query_dimensions(req) self.assertEqual( result, {"Dimension": "Value", "Dimension-2": "Value-2", "Dimension-3": "Value-3"}) def test_malformed_dimension_no_value(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = ("foo=bar&dimensions=no_value") self.assertRaises( falcon.HTTPBadRequest, helpers.get_query_dimensions, req) def test_malformed_dimension_extra_colons(self): req = Mock() req.query_string = ("foo=bar&dimensions=Dimension:Value1:Value2") self.assertRaises( falcon.HTTPBadRequest, helpers.get_query_dimensions, req)

subject: Run growroot after all filesystems are mounted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 00:04:38.000000000', 'files': ['elements/growroot/init-scripts/upstart/growroot.conf'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/diskimage-builder/commit/ea79655a080dc9b0ad39dd425d305d4ba3ad23b8', 'message': 'Run growroot after all filesystems are mounted

Appears that growroot was running before /dev is mounted so the script
is unable to introspect the filesystem partition info. Run this after
all local filesystems are mounted to fix this issue.

Change-Id: Ia7c41ba6ef79788fdbf198998622eeaa20dd4245
'}]
commit_message:
Run growroot after all filesystems are mounted

Appears that growroot was running before /dev is mounted so the script
is unable to introspect the filesystem partition info. Run this after
all local filesystems are mounted to fix this issue.

Change-Id: Ia7c41ba6ef79788fdbf198998622eeaa20dd4245

commit_message:
Support deliverables, not just for neutron

Generically support multiple projects in a single deliverable,
rather than only support the Neutron case.

Change-Id: I96a8e02c1d38368c687564bcba9971c30a137ed1

commit_message:
No longer support Swift in rc*.sh

rc*.sh scripts are specific to preversioned (cycle-with-milestone)
projects.

Swift uses postversion and therefore should make full releases
rather than .0rcX tags (like other intermediary-released things).

Change-Id: I46650f17dda68071941e06d366aec4a9147a13d8

deleted_lines: echo "Usage: $0 SHA series projectname [swift_final_version]" echo "Example: $0 HEAD juno swift 2.1.0"if [[ "$PROJECT" == "swift" ]]; then if [[ $# -eq 4 ]]; then RC1MILESTONE="$4-rc1" else echo "Missing Swift final version number argument !" exit 2 fi else RC1MILESTONE="$SERIES-rc1" fi

commit_message:
Turn on influxdb in gate_hook

This was left out when adding the devstack plugin support for
influxdb. As a result gate jobs use file storage (the default) not
influxdb.

Change-Id: Ib15dbbaf1bad4e399189c0de007c64303eb00473
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/gnocchi refs/changes/82/217782/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: influxdb) DEVSTACK_LOCAL_CONFIG+=$'\nexport GNOCCHI_STORAGE_BACKEND=influxdb' ;;

commit_message:
Use the latest trove client for trove-functional-dsvm job

The current trove-functional-dsvm job uses the trove client from
pypi which may be outdated. Update the job definitions so that it
uses the latest trove client from git instead.

Change-Id: I84d204f50cb18f6e96c48b4340219d8b69ba681c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/15/216915/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: export DEVSTACK_PROJECT_FROM_GIT=python-troveclient

commit_message:
Add mechanism to vm list to return all resources

This patch adds a loop to servers list, which makes calls to API side until
all resources will be listed.

Also, there are several functional tests are added with checks of markers
and limit.

Change-Id: Ic030a68867781cca25e723ab51986d87ecd3ab2e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/01/217101/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_list_all_servers(self): # use marker just to identify this call in fixtures sl = self.cs.servers.list(limit=-1, marker=1234) self.assertEqual(2, len(sl)) self.assertEqual(self.requests.request_history[-2].method, 'GET') self.assertEqual(self.requests.request_history[-2].path_url, '/servers/detail?marker=1234') self.assert_called('GET', '/servers/detail?marker=5678') for s in sl: self.assertIsInstance(s, servers.Server)

commit_message:
Ceilosca deployer scripts

These scripts allow installtion of ceilosca on a local machine.

 - Sets up devstack
 - Sets up ceilosca, modifies config and copies files
 - Sets up monasca on the same local box

Necessary information is in deployer/README.md

Change-Id: I2da63ee7075cee5401594408d44dd8f5881d9fe6

subject: Return complete response from compute images_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-18 10:20:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/da75b441b29cdc041bc8c223484815617205a917', 'message': "Return complete response from compute images_client

Currently compute images_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['image'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute images_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I57818ccf8d0f6a631223a240b20829e5c40c3e6d

commit_message:
Return complete response from compute images_client

Currently compute images_client returns Response by removing
top key from Response.
For example-
return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['image'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute images_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I57818ccf8d0f6a631223a240b20829e5c40c3e6d
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Add rootwrap filters

This patch adds os-bricks list of rootwrap filters for commands
that are needed to execute.   The filters are a self contained entire
list of expected filters that os-brick needs to run.  It's expected that
this filter file is added to any rootwrap enabled service that needs to use
os-brick.

Devstack associated patch: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/207677/

Partial-Bug: #1479842
UpgradeImpact:  Need to place the os-brick.filters file in service's
                rootwrap.d directory to enable filters.

Change-Id: I2b1e657b87c7b27548200a20b991f34c3413c24b

commit_message:
Allowing data sources to be edited

Adding a table row option to be able to edit a given
data source object.  Also adding a couple of tests that go
along with data source creation and editing.

Change-Id: Ic41bc3355973f3dd7e2b171b979776dbbeaa1731
Implements: bp allow-editing-of-data-sources

commit_message:
Fix backwards compatibility on class Root

- Added create and is_root_enabled back into Root
  to maintain backwards compatibility of API.
- Methods just call into the new create_instance_root
  and is_instance_root_enabled methods.

Change-Id: I8ea0e82cd800fe229e8224372bd8edc6c82bf8c4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-troveclient refs/changes/85/217785/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def create(self, instance): """Implements root-enable API Enable the root user and return the root password for the specified db instance. """ self.create_instance_root(instance) body = {"password": root_password} if root_password else None def is_root_enabled(self, instance): """Return whether root is enabled for the instance.""" self.is_instance_root_enabled(instance)

commit_message:
Create new project ceilometer-zvm on stackforge

ceilometer-zvm is a new project that integrates zvm with OpenStack
Ceilometer. It will mainly implements zvm specific inspector, to
make Ceilometer compute agent work with zvm hypervisor.

Enable access of creating tags and branches, for the purpose of
release management.

Change-Id: I50084a4e929672ea5cf105599e740bf5d9cd1423

commit_message:
Enable HAProxy Stats Web UI

This patch enables the HAProxy webstats for all the configures
backends and frontends.

A password entry is added to user_secrets.yml for the webstats
password.

It also adds variables for port number, username and password
which can be overridden in user_variables.yml appropriately.

Change-Id: Iec866ad124bec6fb0b8524a966adf64e22422035
Closes-Bug: #1446432
(cherry picked from commit 79e55616aafc25ff8084a43c4938a4ede4344bb7)

commit_message:
networking-guide: Flesh out introduction to network namespaces

Change-Id: I5220d1c0e00c35ebf6a35cd7ac2dbfcc1c1c2279
Closes-Bug: 1466560
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/83/216783/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: A namespace, in general, is a way of scoping a particular set of identifiers, and thereby making it possible to use the same identifier multiple times - in different namespaces - or to restrict the set of such identifiers that are visible to a particular process. For example, Linux provides namespaces for networking and processes, among other things. If a process is running within a process namespace, it can only see and communicate with other processes in the same namespace. So, if a shell in a particular process namespace ran `ps waux`, it would only show the other processes in the same namespace. Linux network namespaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ In a network namespace, the scoped 'identifiers' are network devices; so a given network device, such as `eth0`, exists in a particular namespace. Linux starts up with a default network namespace, so if your OS doesn't do anything special, that's where all the network devices will be. But it's also possible to create further non-default namespaces, and create new devices in those namespaces, or move an existing device from one namespace to another. Each network namespace also has its own routing table, and in fact this is the main reason for namespaces to exist. A routing table is keyed by destination IP address, so network namespaces are what you need if you want the same destination IP address to mean different things at different times - e.g. exactly what Neutron provides with overlapping IP addresses in different Neutron networks. Each network namespace also has its own set of iptables (for both IPv4 and IPv6). So different security can be applied to flows with the same IP addressing in different namespaces, just as different routing can be. Any given Linux process runs in a particular network namespace. By default this is inherited from its parent process, but a process with the right capabilities can switch itself into a different namespace; in practice this is mostly done using the `ip netns exec NETNS COMMAND...` invocation, which starts `COMMAND` running in the namespace named `NETNS`. Suppose such a process sends out a message to IP address A.B.C.D, the effect of the namespace is that A.B.C.D will be looked up in that namespace's routing table, and that will determine the network device that the message is transmitted through.It is another name for the network namespace functionality described above.
deleted_lines: A namespace is a container for a set of identifiers. Namespaces provide a level of direction to specific identifiers and make it possible to differentiate between identifiers with the same exact name. With network namespaces, you can have different and separate instances of network interfaces and routing tables that operate independently of each other. Linux network namespaces ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ Linux network namespaces provide isolation of the system resources associated with networking. Each network namespace has its own network devices, IP addresses, IP routing tables, iptables, and /proc/net directory.

commit_message:
Follow conventions in Networking Guide

Follow conventions, for example for neutron, Networking, OpenStack.
Also, replace bit.ly URL with URL to actual page.
Use IPv6 instead of v6.

Change-Id: I0c24cb94d86dd24155a639850baa9a05053e9b17

commit_message:
Remove translation

keystoneauth does not support translation and therefore the plugins
should not require/utilize the translation strings either.

Change-Id: Ib8fd1a38ce0d8d43b288c751d620c2663b223ff5

commit_message:
Glance v3 client methods for work with blobs

This commit adds methods for work with BLOB and related tests to the client.
Currently implemented methods: 'delete_blob', 'download_blob', 'upload_blob'

Co-Authored-By: Mike Fedosin <mfedosin@mirantis.com>

FastTrack
Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Change-Id: I29357ee117d7dbdaed58ab12ccb10ba575820b2a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/05/216705/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glanceclient.common import utils """Upload blob data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to download a blob :param blob_property: blob property name :param position: if blob_property is a list then the position must be specified """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) hdrs = {'Content-Type': 'application/octet-stream'} url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id, blob_property) if position: url += "/%s" % position self.http_client.put(url, headers=hdrs, data=data) """Get blob data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to download a blob :param blob_property: blob property name :param position: if blob_property is a list then the position must be specified :param do_checksum: Enable/disable checksum validation. """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id, blob_property) if position: url += '/%s' % position resp, body = self.http_client.get(url) checksum = resp.headers.get('content-md5', None) content_length = int(resp.headers.get('content-length', 0)) if checksum is not None and do_checksum: body = utils.integrity_iter(body, checksum) return utils.IterableWithLength(body, content_length) """Delete blob and related data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to delete a blob :param blob_property: blob property name :param position: if blob_property is a list then the position must be specified """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id, blob_property) if position: url += '/%s' % position self.http_client.delete(url)
deleted_lines: raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError()

commit_message:
Glance v3 client basic methods

This commit adds standard lifecycle methods and related tests
to the client.

Currently implemented methods: 'create', 'update', 'get', 'delete'

FastTrack
Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Change-Id: I03f8be8917cf1de527989c441dde24160854cf59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/04/216704/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glanceclient.v3 import ArtifactType """Create an artifact of given type and version. :param name: name of creating artifact. :param version: semver string describing an artifact version """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) kwargs.update({'name': name, 'version': version}) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/drafts' % (type_name, type_version) resp, body = self.http_client.post(url, data=kwargs) return ArtifactType(**body) """Update attributes of an artifact. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to modify. :param remove_props: List of property names to remove :param \*\*kwargs: Artifact attribute names and their new values. """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id) hdrs = { 'Content-Type': 'application/openstack-images-v2.1-json-patch'} artifact_obj = self.get(artifact_id, type_name, type_version) changes = [] if remove_props: for prop in remove_props: if prop in ArtifactType.generic_properties: msg = "Generic properties cannot be removed" raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) if prop not in kwargs: changes.append([('op', 'remove'), ('path', '/' + prop)]) for prop in kwargs: if prop in artifact_obj.generic_properties: op = 'add' if getattr(artifact_obj, prop) is None else 'replace' elif prop in artifact_obj.type_specific_properties: if artifact_obj.type_specific_properties[prop] is None: op = 'add' else: op = 'replace' else: msg = ("Property '%s' doesn't exist in type '%s' with version" " '%s'" % (prop, type_name, type_version)) raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) changes.append([('op', op), ('path', '/' + prop), ('value', kwargs[prop])]) resp, body = self.http_client.patch(url, headers=hdrs, data=changes) return ArtifactType(**body) """Get information about an artifact. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to get. :param show_level: value of datalization. Possible values: "none", "basic", "direct", "transitive" """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id) if show_level: if show_level not in ArtifactType.supported_show_levels: msg = "Invalid show level: %s" % show_level raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) url += '?show_level=%s' % show_level resp, body = self.http_client.get(url) return ArtifactType(**body) """Delete an artifact and all its data. :param artifact_id: ID of the artifact to delete. """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/%s' % (type_name, type_version, artifact_id) self.http_client.delete(url)
deleted_lines: raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError() raise NotImplementedError()

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/03/216703/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from glanceclient.common import http from glanceclient.common import utils from glanceclient.v3 import artifacts class Client(object): """Client for the OpenStack Glance v3 API. :param string endpoint: A user-supplied endpoint URL for the glance service. :param string token: Token for authentication. :param integer timeout: Allows customization of the timeout for client http requests. (optional) """ def __init__(self, endpoint, type_name, type_version, **kwargs): endpoint, version = utils.strip_version(endpoint) self.version = version or 3.0 self.http_client = http.HTTPClient(endpoint, **kwargs) self.type_name = type_name self.type_version = type_version self.artifacts = artifacts.Controller(self.http_client, self.type_name, self.type_version)

commit_message:
Added process checks for Vertica and InfluxDB

Change-Id: I748e326583997434e590d300a13996f463056042
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/monasca-agent refs/changes/63/215763/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from monasca_setup.detection import find_process_name class MonVertica(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect Vertica and setup some simple checks.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" if (find_process_name('vertica') is not None and find_process_name('spread') is not None): self.available = True def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" log.info("\tEnabling the Monasca Vertica check") config = monasca_setup.agent_config.Plugins() for process in ['vertica', 'spread']: if find_process_name(process) is not None: config.merge(watch_process([process], 'monitoring', process, exact_match=False)) return config def dependencies_installed(self): return True class MonInfluxDB(monasca_setup.detection.Plugin): """Detect InfluxDB and setup some simple checks.""" def _detect(self): """Run detection, set self.available True if the service is detected.""" if find_process_name('influxd') is not None: self.available = True def build_config(self): """Build the config as a Plugins object and return.""" log.info("\tEnabling the Monasca InfluxDB check") return watch_process(['influxd'], 'monitoring', 'influxd', exact_match=False) def dependencies_installed(self): return True

commit_message:
Add a new method validate_raid_config to RAIDInterface

The new method is required because it can be called from
API synchronously to validate the target RAID configuration
before accepting it. The new method explicitly for validating
target RAID configuration, instead of validate() method, makes
sure that we throw an error only if validation of target
RAID configuration fails (validate() method might be validating
other things also like BMC's credentials).

Change-Id: I5903e1f99bb9ebb3ea546c013e5fefa7115060b6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/09/216809/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

The function definition will be as follows:: def validate_raid_config(task, raid_config): """Validates the given RAID configuration. :param task: TaskManager object containing the node. :param raid_config: The target RAID config to validate. :raises: InvalidParameterValue, if RAID configuration is invalid. """

commit_message:
Add placeholder to unset http proxies

This patch adds commented out code that helps to unset various
build environment variables like HTTP_PROXY if the latter were
used during build.

Change-Id: I68e100a2b036dc30b7e72e641c689b765e969b36
Partially-Implements: blueprint add-proxy-to-dockerfiles

commit_message:
Remove rpmbuild directory

The spec files in the rpmbuild directory are very old, and have been
superseded by Greg Swift's work to get Barbican into Fedora.  Parties
interested in rpm packaging of Barbican should refer to Greg's GitHub
repository:

https://github.com/gregswift/barbican-spec

Change-Id: I62b14769574bd2d6662434fb20d75c0eadecccab

commit_message:
Install python-pymysql on Ubuntu

Note: this is a temporary fix and will be reverted once packaging is
fixed upstream.
python-pymysql is a new dependency in Liberty and current OpenStack
packages do not depend on it right now. It's work in progress by Ubuntu
team.

Change-Id: I8470fc063a881bfb523007927c8fd1890058bc91
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone refs/changes/63/217763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # temporary fix until Liberty packaging is fixed in Ubuntu/Debian if $::osfamily == 'Debian' { ensure_resource('package', 'python-pymysql', { 'ensure' => $package_ensure, 'name' => 'python-pymysql', 'tag' => ['openstack'], }) }

commit_message:
add 'boot from ebs' scenario test

test that boots from a snapshot of a volume backed instance
(instance that was booted from bootable volume that was created from image).

Recent changes in nova and cinder broke booting from EBS instance.
For example last change in cinder is here
(that broke booting) - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/182994/

Change-Id: I3915e2f04163568f758bb9e98bd5394af80aa431
Closes-Bug: #1485424
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/21/213621/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 OpenStack Foundation # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_log import log as logging import testtools from tempest.common.utils import data_utils from tempest.common import waiters from tempest import config from tempest.scenario import manager from tempest import test CONF = config.CONF LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TestServerEBSBoot(manager.ScenarioTest): """This creates EBS-image and boots server from it.""" def _create_volume_from_image(self): img_uuid = CONF.compute.image_ref vol_name = data_utils.rand_name('volume-origin') return self.create_volume(name=vol_name, imageRef=img_uuid) def _boot_instance_from_volume(self, vol_id): # NOTE(gfidente): the syntax for block_device_mapping is # dev_name=id:type:size:delete_on_terminate # where type needs to be "snap" if the server is booted # from a snapshot, size instead can be safely left empty bd_map = [{ 'device_name': 'vda', 'volume_id': vol_id, 'delete_on_termination': '0'}] create_kwargs = { 'block_device_mapping': bd_map } return self.create_server(image='', create_kwargs=create_kwargs) def _create_image_from_instance(self, server_id): name = data_utils.rand_name('image') image = self.images_client.create_image(server_id, name=name) image_id = data_utils.parse_image_id(image.response['location']) self.addCleanup(self.images_client.delete_image, image_id) waiters.wait_for_image_status(self.images_client, image_id, 'ACTIVE') waiters.wait_for_server_status(self.servers_client, server_id, 'ACTIVE') return image_id def _delete_server(self, server): self.servers_client.delete_server(server['id']) self.servers_client.wait_for_server_termination(server['id']) @test.idempotent_id('36c34c67-7b54-4b59-b188-02a2f458a63b') @test.services('compute', 'volume', 'image') def test_create_and_boot_ebs_server(self): # create an instance from volume volume_origin = self._create_volume_from_image() instance = self._boot_instance_from_volume(volume_origin['id']) # create EBS image image_id = self._create_image_from_instance(instance['id']) # delete instance self._delete_server(instance) # boot instance from EBS image instance = self.create_server(image=image_id) # just ensure that instance booted # delete instance self._delete_server(instance)

commit_message:
[Sahara] Added volume type and instance locality support

Adding ability:
* to specify volume_type
* to enable volume_local_to_instance function, which allows
volume and instance creation on the same physical host

partially implements bp: volume-instance-locality
Closes-Bug: #1369574

Change-Id: Ie682907e2cfe1fe4f00ceedd310ee0251348eba3

Fix UT fallout

Change Id91907996631b670e23a506e0a1feae4518e42ba turned a couple of
methods to private. This patch fixes the dependency that broke.

Change-Id: I297f550a824785061d43237a98f079d7b0fa99ab

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf8 -*- # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from oslo_config import cfg from oslo_log import log from monasca_api.common.repositories import exceptions from monasca_api.common.repositories import metrics_repository LOG = log.getLogger(__name__) class MetricsRepository(metrics_repository.MetricsRepository): def __init__(self): try: self.conf = cfg.CONF except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex) def list_metrics(self, tenant_id, region, name, dimensions, offset, limit): try: json_metric_list = [] return json_metric_list except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex) def measurement_list(self, tenant_id, region, name, dimensions, start_timestamp, end_timestamp, offset, limit, merge_metrics_flag): try: json_measurement_list = [] return json_measurement_list except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex) def list_metric_names(self, tenant_id, region, dimensions, offset, limit): try: json_name_list = [] return json_name_list except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex) def metrics_statistics(self, tenant_id, region, name, dimensions, start_timestamp, end_timestamp, statistics, period, offset, limit, merge_metrics_flag): try: json_statistics_list = [] return json_statistics_list except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex) def alarm_history(self, tenant_id, alarm_id_list, offset, limit, start_timestamp=None, end_timestamp=None): try: json_alarm_history_list = [] return json_alarm_history_list except Exception as ex: LOG.exception(ex) raise exceptions.RepositoryException(ex)

subject: Update Table to Single HTML for Readability
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 05:38:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/639f105d7df37b179731d668803b25e515a5147f', 'message': 'Update Table to Single HTML for Readability

The multiple table files actually made it more difficult to see
the whole picture of the table. You would have to have multiple files
open to correlate the column headers, column data, and details sections.

Future patches can add additional helper directives to simplify this
even further.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

commit_message:
Update Table to Single HTML for Readability

The multiple table files actually made it more difficult to see
the whole picture of the table. You would have to have multiple files
open to correlate the column headers, column data, and details sections.

Future patches can add additional helper directives to simplify this
even further.

To test set DISABLED = False in _1051_project_ng_images_panel.py

Change-Id: Ic605b1d77b09a0444e38dbb31855f56ab59d399a
Partially-Implements: blueprint angularize-images-table

commit_message:
Correct logging for volume disconnect

The volume disconnect code was logging the entire instance object when
the intent was to log just the name of the instance.  This change aligns
it with volume connect logging.

Change-Id: Ic408f3f486a16dee55b640ae1fcdda5a2aa48012

commit_message:
Use inifile for tempest_*_id_setter provider

The current (old) implementation can't work with current tempest, since
the parameter needs to be in a specific section (compute or network).
Let's refactor to use inifile like it should be done.

Change-Id: I55fc5d638672f641f02568e8f9d74cbe8b648cd5

commit_message:
Remove fixed interval looper to eventlet thread

This change modifies the PVID Looper to use an eventlet based thread.
This resolves an excessive logging issue that could occur.

The previous mechanism would always run a new pass after 1 second -
regardless of if the previous loop had finished.  This would allow
multiple update requests to go through at once.  Subsequent runs could
actually send a failure request.

This change makes it so that only one loop pass can run at a time.  It
also adds some additional logging in the event of a failure to help
guide the admin to the root issue.

Change-Id: I9d5b0e023f91bbc3817ecbb6b395f5f6230214b7

commit_message:
Accept removable block devices by PCI vendor ID

The issue is that, for particular raid controller obtaning vendor of
block device from sysfs attributes is not realible.

Once every raid controller is connected to PCI bus directly,
it's more realible to look at vendor ID of that controller to which
removable block device belongs.

For example, Adaptec is a perfect canditate to be added to a list of
removable PCI vendor IDs, since it's manufacturing RAID controllers
mostly.

Change-Id: Ib1018abbb46c65d909e594ad1d8921c8c5a139fc
Related-Bug: #1486601
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-nailgun-agent refs/changes/07/216307/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: REMOVABLE_PCI_VENDORS = [ "0x1044", "0x9004", "0x9005", ] # Assuming that all devices connected to system-wide PCI bus. True for all modern x86 systems. # So the last attribute goes for PCI vendor ID of controller. pci_vendor_id = val = `udevadm info --attribute-walk --name=#{bname}`.split("\n").select{|i| i =~ /ATTRS\{vendor\}/ }.last.split('==').last.chomp('"').reverse.chomp('"').reverse @logger.debug("Block device #{bname} is removable. PCI vendor ID: #{pci_vendor_id}") if ! REMOVABLE_PCI_VENDORS.include?(pci_vendor_id) next end @logger.debug("Block device #{bname} is accepted by PCI vendor ID")

commit_message:
Unify Centos and Ubuntu Source Install - Murano

A change merged in the base allows for Centos and Ubuntu to install
all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I7b3504874088bae76c9dcb429c8aa8e0fd307a8e
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu

commit_message:
In test_rest run process_measures after a request

When done before we are not guaranteeing that the request just made
is processed in a way that a subsequent assertion expects.

Presumably the previous way was done to say "make sure the previous
request was fully processed before doing this request, which is a
confirmation". However we have seen intermittent test failures where
expected measures are not present in result sets.

Change-Id: I67a0e24195b3fe2d8406495fedd072307b552990

commit_message:
Add Ironic API support

Adds support for the Ironic API and ironicclient, so the panels and rest
of the UI can be built on top of this.

Change-Id: I63fe04d99ce5ff260b66a4a3c0815b2ceacd3ea6
Partial-Implements: blueprint node-management-ui

commit_message:
Unify Centos and Ubuntu Source Install - Nova

A change merged in the base allows for Centos and Ubuntu to install
all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Change-Id: I58708a4e7375f20622c944539a41336333d3bfcb
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu

commit_message:
Fix amqp1 job in stable/kilo (2 backports)

This patch contains 2 backports from master. Unfortunately, an update on
f21 is forcing to update the requirements for amqp1. Therefore, we need
these 2 commits, which depend on each other, to be backported as one.

Commit 1:

Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

Commit 2:

Fix qpid's functional gate

The loggin verbosity changed in 0.32 which our gate is pulling from the
updates repository. This patch updates the script to make it work again.

Closes-bug: #1468917
Change-Id: I88a1bc794246beb156d4301bd503fa51a7cd2cce
(cherry picked from commit 079c04f0d06539f3507c772ccc68807a6d01a73a)

commit_message:
WIP: Fix py27 unittests in stable/kilo (2 backports)

Commit 1:

Fix list_opts test to not check all deps

The list_opts entrypoint test failed unnecessarily when the
dependencies in the packages were inconsistent. This test doesn't
need to verify that the dependencies are consistent, only that the
entrypoint is available and provides the expected function.

Cherry-Picked from: 3d483fda709d2d04db2222e0119eaa54de5f5867

Commit 2:

Fix mock use for mock 1.1.0

Correct the way we check the calls by using the proper mock method. Add
a new test to expand coverage of the area being fixed.

Cherry-Picked from c7b31385ac3616060ef0f2188fb724191caad03c

Related-Bug: #1488456

Change-Id: I52dcf12be11bb57a47235735f7b46aafdf602261

subject: WIP: Propagate nova context through FeedTasks
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-25 23:13:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/media.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_npiv.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_live_migration.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/storage.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/driver.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/vios.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/volume/test_vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/volume/vscsi.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/disk/localdisk.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/live_migration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova-powervm/commit/1f570dc46ed407f82d2f5e272c9834a52fe2115c', 'message': "WIP: Propagate nova context through FeedTasks

(Need to figure out how to UT this.)

Bug 1487535 complains that the nova security context is not being
propagated down into TaskFlow Tasks running in parallel engines (i.e.
separate threads).  The immediately-noticeable result is that log
messages don't include the expected request ID.

The main use of parallel TaskFlow engines in nova-powervm is via
pypowervm FeedTasks.  This change set gets the context propagated down
into all instances of FeedTask, which should address the problem for
most or all current code paths.

More work needs to be done, however, to ensure that other Tasks, which
may eventually run in a separate thread, also get their context set
properly.

Depends on pypowervm change in branch bug/1487535.

Change-Id: Icb24084d7395382306df782237c7808b830d90c9
Closes-Bug: 1487535
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: Propagate nova context through FeedTasks

(Need to figure out how to UT this.)

Bug 1487535 complains that the nova security context is not being
propagated down into TaskFlow Tasks running in parallel engines (i.e.
separate threads).  The immediately-noticeable result is that log
messages don't include the expected request ID.

The main use of parallel TaskFlow engines in nova-powervm is via
pypowervm FeedTasks.  This change set gets the context propagated down
into all instances of FeedTask, which should address the problem for
most or all current code paths.

More work needs to be done, however, to ensure that other Tasks, which
may eventually run in a separate thread, also get their context set
properly.

Depends on pypowervm change in branch bug/1487535.

Change-Id: Icb24084d7395382306df782237c7808b830d90c9
Closes-Bug: 1487535

commit_message:
Remove CONFIG_STRATEGY prefix

We no longer have CONFIG_INTERNAL and moving forward CONFIG_STRATEGY
infront of COPY_ALWAYS or COPY_ONCE will just lead to confusion.

Change-Id: Ie0d71637e25cbd79d46e1cdca62df714c10b85d2
Implements: blueprint update-configs

deleted_lines: CONFIG_INTERNAL) echo "Config internal no longer exists in this project." exit 1 ;; CONFIG_EXTERNAL_COPY_ALWAYS) CONFIG_EXTERNAL_COPY_ONCE)

commit_message:
Add category list pagination support

Pagination was added to the 'Manage->Categories' page.

For getting category list 'catalog/categories' is used
everywhere. Before there were places where 'catalog/packages/categories' used.
This call is deprecated.

Also added handle of BadRequest error to common exception handler,
so if invalid sort key is passed, dashboard will stay alive.

Change-Id: I80758dce32fc3930250f8924d3243a7a1cdbda80
Related-bug: #1474932

added_lines: import itertools from django.conf import settingsfrom horizon.utils import functions as utils def has_prev_data(self, table): return self._prev def has_more_data(self, table): return self._more def get_data(self): prev_marker = self.request.GET.get( tables.CategoriesTable._meta.prev_pagination_param, None) if prev_marker is not None: sort_dir = 'asc' marker = prev_marker else: sort_dir = 'desc' marker = self.request.GET.get( tables.CategoriesTable._meta.pagination_param, None) limit = getattr(settings, 'API_RESULT_LIMIT', 1000) page_size = utils.get_page_size(self.request) request_size = page_size + 1 kwargs = {'filters': {}} if marker: kwargs['marker'] = marker kwargs['sort_dir'] = sort_dir kwargs['sort_key'] = 'created' self._prev = False self._more = False with api.handled_exceptions(self.request): categories_iter = api.muranoclient(self.request).categories.list( page_size=request_size, limit=limit, **kwargs) categories = list(itertools.islice(categories_iter, request_size)) # first and middle page condition if len(categories) > page_size: categories.pop(-1) self._more = True # middle page condition if marker is not None: self._prev = True # first page condition when reached via prev back elif sort_dir == 'asc' and marker is not None: self._more = True # last page condition elif marker is not None: self._prev = True if prev_marker is not None: categories = sorted(categories, key=lambda cat: getattr(cat, 'created'), reverse=True) return categories

commit_message:
Add services ports to AllowConnect in Apache

OSTF needs to check services via HTTPS. To achieve this,
extra ports were added to Apache proxy:

* 5000 - keystone
* 8000, 8003, 8004 - heat
* 8080 - ceph radosgw (or swift)
* 8082 - murano
* 8386 - sahara
* 8773, 8774 - nova
* 8776 - cinder
* 8777 - ceilometer
* 9292 - glance
* 9696 - neutron

Closes-Bug: #1489408
Change-Id: If599d8eead56d340583e46602373f7ddb2842b00

commit_message:
Tests: Fix zfssa TestRestClientURL.test_request

This test can currently fail with mismatched parameters
to urlopen.  Just ensure that urlopen is called so
that this works across all environments/versions.

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from horizon.utils import memoized from openstack_dashboard.api import base from senlinclient import client as senlin_client from senlinclient.common import sdk USER_AGENT = 'python-senlinclient' @memoized.memoized def senlinclient(request, password=None): api_version = "1" kwargs = { 'auth_url': base.url_for(request, 'clustering'), 'token': request.user.token.id, 'username': request.user.username, 'password': password, 'project_id': request.user.tenant_id } conn = sdk.create_connection({}, USER_AGENT, **kwargs) return senlin_client.Client(api_version, conn.session)

subject: Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-27 11:39:27.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/api/zaqar.transport.wsgi.app.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/8207a69951fd3545d6fba3384cad2149bdb38a4f', 'message': "Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app

We've been generating docs for the `zaqar.transport.wsgi.app` module,
which tries to create an instance of the wsgi transport, which then
tries to create an instance of the data controller and connect to the
database.

This module does not contain any docs and we shouldn't require a running
DB instance to generate these docs.

Change-Id: Id1c3cabc61a790bc0e5cccb22e660c933788ded8
Closes-bug: #1489426
"}]
commit_message:
Don't generate docs for zaqar.transport.wsgi.app

We've been generating docs for the `zaqar.transport.wsgi.app` module,
which tries to create an instance of the wsgi transport, which then
tries to create an instance of the data controller and connect to the
database.

This module does not contain any docs and we shouldn't require a running
DB instance to generate these docs.

Change-Id: Id1c3cabc61a790bc0e5cccb22e660c933788ded8
Closes-bug: #1489426
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/52/217652/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update from global requirements

This syncs up the requirements with global-requirements on stable/juno.

We need this to cap the dependency on futures to avoid a conflict
with capped futures in the version of taskflow in stable/juno, otherwise
setting up devstack with cinder enabled fails.

Also update .gitreview for stable/juno since this is the first patch
on the new branch.

Also sets up the tox func target, which is basically a cherry pick of
commit 8aff0bda9c35ab96146f4f419803e62710ab5618. Note that while we
make it possible to run the functional tests, we exclude them in
Jenkins runs since they are also excluded from stable/kilo due to
instability in the gate.

Depends-On: I5a2d3f7860aeae6bf442e9372286eedbc290d6a8

Change-Id: I507aade31da19be71900b81880cd5568b351663e
Partial-Bug: #1486576

commit_message:
Add port type on port option

According to [1] 
oslo.config can use portType to support the ability to set valid range 
on port option values. 
[1]: http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/cfg.html

Change-Id: I71b6c7347f00e903321947074cdd55ee261bb505

commit_message:
Refactor action constructor

An action has two mandatory parameters in its constructor, 'target' and
'action'. This patch makes 'target' an positional argument for the
constructor.

Change-Id: I798cc498f909f352ca7c443b0bc07afd83c73b69

Fixing working concurrency when value is YAQL

Closes-Bug: #1487651

Change-Id: I45abd0c064f4e1be9aee86f4488281ecb9830a62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/mistral refs/changes/27/217127/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_with_items_concurrency_yaql(self): workflow_with_concurrency_yaql = """--- version: "2.0" concurrency_test: type: direct input: - names: ["John", "Ivan", "Mistral"] - concurrency tasks: task1: action: std.echo output=<% $.name %> with-items: name in <% $.names %> concurrency: <% $.concurrency %> """ wf_service.create_workflows(workflow_with_concurrency_yaql) # Start workflow. wf_ex = self.engine.start_workflow( 'concurrency_test', {'concurrency': 2} ) self._await( lambda: self.is_execution_success(wf_ex.id), ) wf_ex = db_api.get_workflow_execution(wf_ex.id) task_ex = wf_ex.task_executions[0] # Since we know that we can receive results in random order, # check is not depend on order of items. result = data_flow.get_task_execution_result(task_ex) self.assertTrue(isinstance(result, list)) self.assertIn('John', result) self.assertIn('Ivan', result) self.assertIn('Mistral', result) self.assertEqual(states.SUCCESS, task_ex.state) def test_with_items_concurrency_yaql_wrong_type(self): workflow_with_concurrency_yaql = """--- version: "2.0" concurrency_test: type: direct input: - names: ["John", "Ivan", "Mistral"] - concurrency tasks: task1: action: std.echo output=<% $.name %> with-items: name in <% $.names %> concurrency: <% $.concurrency %> """ wf_service.create_workflows(workflow_with_concurrency_yaql) # Start workflow. exception = self.assertRaises( exc.InvalidModelException, self.engine.start_workflow, 'concurrency_test', {'concurrency': '2'} ) self.assertIn( "Invalid data type in ConcurrencyPolicy", exception.message )

Use JsonEncoded{Dict,List} from oslo_db

Change-Id: I6aec5e40cefaab7f740bfa02d0386b7fc93aaae1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/39/215739/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_db.sqlalchemy import types as db_types extra = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) drivers = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedList) instance_info = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) properties = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) driver_info = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) driver_internal_info = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) clean_step = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) raid_config = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) target_raid_config = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) extra = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict) extra = Column(db_types.JsonEncodedDict)
deleted_lines: import json from sqlalchemy.types import TypeDecorator, TEXTclass JsonEncodedType(TypeDecorator): """Abstract base type serialized as json-encoded string in db.""" type = None impl = TEXT def process_bind_param(self, value, dialect): if value is None: # Save default value according to current type to keep the # interface the consistent. value = self.type() elif not isinstance(value, self.type): raise TypeError("%s supposes to store %s objects, but %s given" % (self.__class__.__name__, self.type.__name__, type(value).__name__)) serialized_value = json.dumps(value) return serialized_value def process_result_value(self, value, dialect): if value is not None: value = json.loads(value) return value class JSONEncodedDict(JsonEncodedType): """Represents dict serialized as json-encoded string in db.""" type = dict class JSONEncodedList(JsonEncodedType): """Represents list serialized as json-encoded string in db.""" type = list extra = Column(JSONEncodedDict) drivers = Column(JSONEncodedList) instance_info = Column(JSONEncodedDict) properties = Column(JSONEncodedDict) driver_info = Column(JSONEncodedDict) driver_internal_info = Column(JSONEncodedDict) clean_step = Column(JSONEncodedDict) raid_config = Column(JSONEncodedDict) target_raid_config = Column(JSONEncodedDict) extra = Column(JSONEncodedDict) extra = Column(JSONEncodedDict)

commit_message:
Refactor _supports_bind method

This commit just makes the logic for _support_bind a little
easier to understand. It also makes it so that the BaseProvider is raising
the NotImplemented exception if a specific provider doesn't support bind
authentication. Instead, each token provider should just return True or False
if it supports bind authentication.

Change-Id: Idc6c380a66e7097366d48760523b7e68271a7798
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/99/197699/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_supports_bind_authentication_does_not_raise_not_implemented(self): # NOTE(lbragstad): This shouldn't raise a NotImplemented error since # the UUID token provider support bind authentication. self.provider._supports_bind

commit_message:
Update NetApp cDOT Manila drivers to use netapp_lib

Like other vendors, NetApp has published a storage controller
client library to PyPI for use by its OpenStack drivers.  This
patch updates the NetApp cDOT Manila drivers to use the new
library.  In particular, the unit tests must still work in the
gate in the absence of the new library.

Implements bp: use-pypi-client-library-in-netapp-cdot-drivers
Change-Id: I362f7ea584bb15a39c761fb5114391f557506764
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/manila refs/changes/53/215353/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from manila.tests.share.drivers.netapp.dataontap.client \ import fake_api as netapp_api # Inject fake netapp_lib module classes. netapp_api.mock_netapp_lib([lib_multi_svm])

commit_message:
Get latest deployment tasks for stop

If there are old deployment tasks, during stop
deployment searilization, oldest task retrieved
and sent to orchestrator.

Change-Id: I433e39d65ed51ba19267687acddffdf986aa89f9
Closes-bug: #1488595

subject: Revert "Set datapath to $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE for bridges"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 14:10:37.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/ovs_base', 'lib/neutron_plugins/openvswitch_agent'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/112852400a21a19df752d77ca39bc5d9a70299aa', 'message': 'Revert "Set datapath to $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE for bridges"

This commit breaks my DevStack - the neutron q-agent fails to start with
the following error:

2015-08-26 10:00:50.277 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-bcb74e98-5a8c-4113-8a43-8a7703502cde None None] Bridge br-ex for physical network public does not exist. Agent terminated!

The commit that added $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE failed to set a sane default,
and no documentation for what are recommended values should be set for
$OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE. This was a failue on my part when reviewing the
original path.

This reverts commit d4c89289f9d4bf88c065dca85a46c9b08464b56c.

Change-Id: I848b14f546f60158fb5b2d47c5fa170f6a3ed44f
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Set datapath to $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE for bridges"

This commit breaks my DevStack - the neutron q-agent fails to start with
the following error:

2015-08-26 10:00:50.277 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-bcb74e98-5a8c-4113-8a43-8a7703502cde None None] Bridge br-ex for physical network public does not exist. Agent terminated!

The commit that added $OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE failed to set a sane default,
and no documentation for what are recommended values should be set for
$OVS_DATAPATH_TYPE. This was a failue on my part when reviewing the
original path.

This reverts commit d4c89289f9d4bf88c065dca85a46c9b08464b56c.

Change-Id: I848b14f546f60158fb5b2d47c5fa170f6a3ed44f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/02/217202/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: sudo ovs-vsctl --no-wait -- --may-exist add-br $OVS_PHYSICAL_BRIDGE sudo ovs-vsctl --no-wait -- --may-exist add-br "br-$GUEST_INTERFACE_DEFAULT"

Change-Id: Ia7be12a441bfc0f68c089d6b98f0d4ba2fff96ed
Closes-Bug: #1488585

commit_message:
Properly skip nova tests if nova isn't available

This commit adds a missing skip exception on the compute api tests if
nova isn't configured as available. The compute tests all require nova
but this skip check was missing for whatever reason.

Change-Id: Ia7be12a441bfc0f68c089d6b98f0d4ba2fff96ed
Closes-Bug: #1488585
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/96/216796/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if not CONF.service_available.nova: raise cls.skipException("Nova is not available")

revisions:

commit_message:
Catch OverQuota in volume create function

Volume API may raise OverQuota exception to nova API
layer, so nova volume API should catch it and raise
HTTPForbidden just like other API.

according to new rule on the footnote[1] of following doc
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/doc/source/api_microversion_dev.rst
no microversion will be used for this change.

Closes-Bug: 1444559

Change-Id: Ia782ab9d9a31d37854606f7be82582de6d7bc374
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/85/173985/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: except exception.OverQuota as err: raise exc.HTTPForbidden(explanation=err.format_message())

commit_message:
Fix volume backup import test

There is a bug in Cinder (#1455043) and backups are incorrectly imported
into the DB, and once that is fixed current tempest backup import/export
test will fail.

The reason for mentioned failure is that backup imports preserve
original backup id, so we cannot import a backup to a system where it
already exists, as is the case of our test.

This patch fixes this by importing the backup with a "fake" uuid so that
the import doesn't give an error.

This test would fail for incremental backups (which we are not using in
the test) and back-ends that require the ID to be preserved (which are
already skipping this test), so there's no problem.

I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5
Related-Bug: #1476416 Change-Id:
I38e1a7b7d269278acd7963b990a263acd3d6e0d5

Change-Id: Ia5b44007c98b8db5492d5eff9778d648e8493507
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/97/216397/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import base64import six def _decode_url(self, backup_url): return json.loads(base64.decodestring(backup_url)) def _encode_backup(self, backup): retval = json.dumps(backup) if six.PY3: retval = retval.encode('utf-8') return base64.encodestring(retval) def modify_backup_url(self, backup_url, changes): backup = self._decode_url(backup_url) backup.update(changes) return self._encode_backup(backup)

are checked in nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.get_dev_prefix_for_disk_bus
so they should be defined in the enum field.

Note that there is no object compat shim for this change since before

pairs, including whatever was using for disk_bus which may or may not

ImageMetaProps object, if some image properties have 'lxc' or 'uml'

since those values aren't in the DiskBus enum field until this change.
There isn't compat logic to backport since that would mean going back
to the broken state and not allowing 'lxc' or 'uml' disk_bus values,
even though they were valid before ImageMetaProps was added.  Plus the
DiskBus enum field isn't versioned, so it's not like an older version
of ImageMetaProps with hw_cdrom_bus='lxc' won't work and we have to
check for it.

Closes-Bug: #1471953

commit_message:
objects: add missing enum values to DiskBus field

This adds the 'lxc' and 'uml' values to the DiskBus enum field. These
are checked in nova.virt.libvirt.blockinfo.get_dev_prefix_for_disk_bus
so they should be defined in the enum field.

Note that there is no object compat shim for this change since before
ImageMetaProps, the image metadata properties could have any key/value
pairs, including whatever was used for disk_bus which may or may not
have been validated by the virt driver.  With the introduction of the
ImageMetaProps object, if some image properties have 'lxc' or 'uml'
disk_bus values we'll get a ValueError trying to construct the object
since those values aren't in the DiskBus enum field until this change.
There isn't compat logic to backport since that would mean going back
to the broken state and not allowing 'lxc' or 'uml' disk_bus values,
even though they were valid before ImageMetaProps was added.  Plus the
DiskBus enum field isn't versioned, so it's not like an older version
of ImageMetaProps with hw_cdrom_bus='lxc' won't work and we have to
check for it.

Closes-Bug: #1471953

Change-Id: I1060925d074f5de46c07101d7af5471fd12390cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/80/200280/10 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Return complete response from compute networks_client
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-24 07:22:25.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/c7afc4dd72112ae3df14b1222624044cd1ef5fe9', 'message': "Return complete response from compute networks_client

Currently compute networks_client returns Response by
removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['network'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute networks_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I953c9daf10e8b0d07f6999fd4a61330222c1d2e5

commit_message:
Return complete response from compute networks_client

Currently compute networks_client returns Response by
removing top key from Response.
For example-
 return service_client.ResponseBody(resp, body['network'])

As service clients are in direction to move to Tempest-lib, all
service clients should return Response without any truncation.
One good example is Resource pagination links which are lost with current
way of return value. Resource pagination links are present in parallel
(not inside) to top key of Response.

This patch makes compute networks_client to return complete
Response body.

Change-Id: I953c9daf10e8b0d07f6999fd4a61330222c1d2e5
Implements: blueprint method-return-value-and-move-service-clients-to-lib

commit_message:
Fix remote_consoles microversion 2.8 not to run on /v3

Currently remote console tests for version 2.8 runs on /v3 as _api_version
was mentioned as 'v3'.

This commit makes those tests run on v2.1 as other microversion tests runs.

Later v3 endpoint will be removed from api_paste.ini.

Partially implements blueprint test-collapse-v2-and-v21

Change-Id: I7a7bdb34e4118170d97fcdfb78a5ca68b5cfd51a

commit_message:
Nil out inst.host and inst.node when build fails

This patch addresses a bug that leaves instance.host/node set after
a VM fails to build or reschedule (e.g., due to an error in the spawn
path). Rather, we should nil these out at the end of the build
process so that the instance is not erroneously being associated
with stale host/node information.

Also included are a few cosmetic updates in comments and eliminating
some implied 'None' parameters from "dict.get(key, None)" calls I
found during the course of investigating this change.

Change-Id: I4d9c90b1d3fcce5237323fffcc6db1fb93d23e37
Closes-Bug: #1427944

deleted_lines: self._set_instance_host_and_node(context, instance_ref) self._set_instance_host_and_node(context, instance_ref) def _set_instance_host_and_node(self, context, instance_ref): values = {'host': self.host, 'node': self.nodename, 'launched_on': self.host}

commit_message:
do not redefine path in elasticsearch

in I0272d56bc2e50e8174db78bd449f65f60f7f4000, we reset DEST value
when installing elasticsearch. it gets set to /opt/stack/ which is
not always correct in gate causing the path to be wrong and
elasticseach cannot be installed. we should reuse DEST from stackrc

Change-Id: Ia3a2383ada30c4e92c37386aedd6164c69cac60a
Closes-Bug: #1484182

commit_message:
New db api method instance_get_all_by_grantee_security_groups()

In order to reduce the number of db calls made during security group
rules refresh, thsi introduces a new db api method that with a single
db call accomplishes what currently needs n db calls equal to the
number of security_groups an instance has plus n db calls equal to
the set of rules found for those security groups.

A follow up patch will make use of this to add a new method to the
instance object, which later will be used to replace existing db
calls in compute api trigger_members_refresh().

Related to blueprint liberty-objects

Change-Id: I8370ccb71c871f169f8235a9d188aac059573880

commit_message:
Make pagination work with changes-since and deleted marker

Currently, Nova does not paginate correctly if changes-since is
being used and the marker is a deleted server. When trying to
get servers with changes-since and marker, a "BadRequest" error
saying that the marker is not found will be raised.

Fixes the bug by passing read_deleted to context when getting
server to enable to get deleted server as marker.

Closes-bug: #1481812
Related-Bug: #1398086
Signed-off-by: Martin Schuppert <mschuppert@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I6e54bd01a8d45ee0b1618724c4cbefc011c079f9
modified: add test
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/14/212614/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
