commit_message:
Move wait_for_server_termination from servers_client

wait_for_server_termination of compute client is just a wrapper.
So the method seems redundant and it doesn't fit as service clients.

This patch moves wait_for_server_termination to waiters module which
contains similar methods.

Partially implements blueprint consistent-service-method-names

Change-Id: Ib738ad91bb5e7344b6a342f23f867df42b833608

commit_message:
Add test for volume-backed instance with certain flavor

Volume-backed instances should not pay attention to flavor disk
attribute, because flavor.disk means size of host local disk space
allocated for instance's root disk, but volume-backed instances do not
use host disk space for their root volumes.

This patch adds tests which boot volume-backed instances by various ways
with flavor.disk smaller than their root volumes.

# min_size=0: Depends-On: I8f35a46069ef4bbb320d1516405e4942843b12fa
# avoid check:
Depends-On: I264493172da20b664df571e32876030246c2a87c
Change-Id: If57a936063ec866f14beca7deafafb2222fc629c

boot from image case server = self.create_test_server( wait_until='ACTIVE', flavor=flavor['id'], image_id=None, block_device_mapping_v2=[{'uuid': image_id, 'source_type': 'image', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'volume_size': 2, 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': False}]) volume_id = (self.client.get_server(server['id']) ['os-extended-volumes:volumes_attached'][0]['id']) self.volumes_ids.append(volume_id) self.delete_server(server['id']) # boot from volume case server = self.create_test_server( wait_until='ACTIVE', flavor=flavor['id'], image_id=None, block_device_mapping_v2=[{'uuid': volume_id, 'source_type': 'volume', 'destination_type': 'volume', 'boot_index': 0, 'delete_on_termination': True}]) # boot from volume-backed image case vb_image = self.create_image_from_server( server['id'], name=data_utils.rand_name('image'), wait_until='ACTIVE') snapshot_id = (vb_image['metadata']['block_device_mapping'][0] ['snapshot_id']) self.addCleanup(self.delete_snapshot, snapshot_id) self.snapshots_client.wait_for_snapshot_status(snapshot_id, 'available') server = self.create_test_server( wait_until='ACTIVE', flavor=flavor['id'], image_id=vb_image['id']) @test.idempotent_id('59051171-cce3-4fb1-9609-39dea7c6008c') def test_flavor_disk_vs_image_min_disk_for_volume_backed_instance(self): base_image = self.glance_client.show_image(self.image_ref) image_file = self.glance_client.load_image_file(self.image_ref) image = self.glance_client.create_image( data_utils.rand_name('image'), base_image['container_format'], base_image['disk_format'], min_disk=2) self.images.append(image['id']) self.glance_client.store_image_file(image['id'], image_file.data) waiters.wait_for_image_status(self.glance_client, image['id'], 'active') self._test_flavor_disk_vs_volume_backed_instance(image['id']) @test.idempotent_id('edb8653f-f379-44d6-b8f8-5f4cb9871d0e') def test_flavor_disk_vs_image_size_for_volume_backed_instance(self): volume = self.volumes_client.create_volume(size=2, imageRef=self.image_ref) self.addCleanup(self.volumes_client.delete_volume, volume['id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') image = self.volumes_client.upload_volume( volume['id'], data_utils.rand_name('image'), CONF.volume.disk_format) self.addCleanup(self.glance_client.delete_image, image['image_id']) self.volumes_client.wait_for_volume_status(volume['id'], 'available') waiters.wait_for_image_status(self.glance_client, image['image_id'], 'active') self._test_flavor_disk_vs_volume_backed_instance(image['image_id'])

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-web refs/changes/23/214523/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Each test set (sanity, smoke, HA and platform_tests) contains a special If you are to develop a new set of tests, you need to create __init__.py module "exclusive_testsets": [], "available_since_release": "2015.2-6.1", in which the test set will be displayed. For example, if you set "6" for smoke and sanity test set profiles, then these tests will be run not - available_since_release field is responsible for the release version starting from which a particular test set can be run. This means that the test will run only on the specified or newer version of Fuel.
deleted_lines: Each test set (sanity, smoke, ha and platform_tests) contains a special If you are develop a new set of tests, you need to create __init__.py module "exclusive_testsets": [] in which the test set will be displayed, for example, if you set "6" for smoke and sanity test set profiles, then these tests will be ran not

commit_message:
Enable amqp's protocol unit tests everywhere

Now that python-qpid-proton has taken an approach similar to zmq's, it's
possible to install it in boxes where the C libraries are not present in
the system. This patch takes advantage of that to enable amqp protocol's
tests everywhere.

Note that the backport was modified to match the stable/kilo gate
configuration. This job, in Kilo, is supposed to run *just* on f21,
therefore, I've removed the changes to the tox.ini to avoid installing
the dependencies everywhere.

Change-Id: Ibce4c791aafadf45fa876d6a4f5373fde94769ff
(cherry picked from commit f06b19628fbb11a32797f1095eba7c07b6343433)

commit_message:
Glance v3 client listing support

This commit adds a method for listing artifacts with related test
coverage.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Change-Id: Ibee33e6e4e6a3d4525d1fbdc201d11ca168f636d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/50/198450/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo_utils import encodeutils import six from six.moves.urllib import parse self.default_page_size = 20 self.sort_dir_values = ('asc', 'desc') self.sort_key_values = ('name', 'status', 'container_format', 'disk_format', 'size', 'id', 'created_at', 'updated_at') def _validate_sort_param(self, sort): """Validates sorting argument for invalid keys and directions values. :param sort: comma-separated list of sort keys with optional <:dir> after each key """ for sort_param in sort.strip().split(','): key, _sep, dir = sort_param.partition(':') if dir and dir not in self.sort_dir_values: msg = ('Invalid sort direction: %(sort_dir)s.' ' It must be one of the following: %(available)s.' ) % {'sort_dir': dir, 'available': ', '.join(self.sort_dir_values)} raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) if key not in self.sort_key_values: msg = ('Invalid sort key: %(sort_key)s.' ' It must be one of the following: %(available)s.' ) % {'sort_key': key, 'available': ', '.join(self.sort_key_values)} raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) return sort 'Content-Type': 'application/openstack-artifacts-v3.0-json-patch'} """Retrieve a listing of Image objects. :param page_size: Number of images to request in each paginated request. :returns: generator over list of artifacts. """ type_name, type_version = self._check_type_params(type_name, type_version) limit = kwargs.get('limit') page_size = kwargs.get('page_size') or self.default_page_size def paginate(url, page_size, limit=None): next_url = url while True: if limit and page_size > limit: next_url = next_url.replace("limit=%s" % page_size, "limit=%s" % limit) resp, body = self.http_client.get(next_url) for artifact in body['artifacts']: yield ArtifactType(**artifact) if limit: limit -= 1 if limit <= 0: raise StopIteration try: next_url = body['next'] except KeyError: return filters = kwargs.get('filters', {}) filters['limit'] = page_size tags = filters.pop('tag', []) tags_url_params = [] for tag in tags: if not isinstance(tag, six.string_types): raise exc.HTTPBadRequest("Invalid tag value %s" % tag) tags_url_params.append({'tag': encodeutils.safe_encode(tag)}) for param, value in six.iteritems(filters): if isinstance(value, six.string_types): filters[param] = encodeutils.safe_encode(value) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s/?%s' % (type_name, type_version, parse.urlencode(filters)) for param in tags_url_params: url = '%s&%s' % (url, parse.urlencode(param)) if 'sort' in kwargs: url = '%s&sort=%s' % (url, self._validate_sort_param( kwargs['sort'])) for artifact in paginate(url, page_size, limit): yield artifact

commit_message:
Glance v3 client methods for work with blobs

This commit adds methods for work with BLOB and related tests to the client.
Currently implemented methods: 'delete_blob', 'download_blob', 'upload_blob'

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

commit_message:
Glance v3 client basic methods

This commit adds standard lifecycle methods and related tests
to the client.

Currently implemented methods: 'create', 'update', 'get', 'delete'

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Change-Id: I03f8be8917cf1de527989c441dde24160854cf59
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/61/192261/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glanceclient import exc """Create an artifact of given type and version.""" type_name = kwargs.get('type_name', self.type_name) type_version = kwargs.get('type_version', self.type_version) if type_name is None: msg = "Type name must be specified" raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) if type_version is None: msg = "Type version must be specified" raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) for param in ['name', 'version']: if param not in kwargs: msg = "Parameter '%s' must be specified" % param raise exc.HTTPBadRequest(msg) url = '/v3/artifacts/%s/v%s' % (type_name, type_version) return self.http_client.post(url, data=kwargs)

commit_message:
Glance v3 client initial commit

This commit provides initial support for Glance v3 api and creates
stubs for methods.

Implements-blueprint: artifact-repository

Change-Id: I83bf3eed4e2c44687f001e98be264fa75f16b349
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-glanceclient refs/changes/60/189860/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2015 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from glanceclient.common import http from glanceclient.common import utils from glanceclient.v3 import artifacts from glanceclient.v3 import schemas class Client(object): """Client for the OpenStack Glance v3 API. :param string endpoint: A user-supplied endpoint URL for the glance service. :param string token: Token for authentication. :param integer timeout: Allows customization of the timeout for client http requests. (optional) """ def __init__(self, endpoint, type_name, type_version, **kwargs): endpoint, version = utils.strip_version(endpoint) self.version = version or 3.0 self.http_client = http.HTTPClient(endpoint, **kwargs) self.type_name = type_name self.type_version = type_version self.schemas = schemas.Controller(self.http_client) self.artifacts = artifacts.Controller(self.http_client, self.schemas, self.type_name, self.type_version)

commit_message:
Enable db migration head check

adds a check to pep8 to verify that the migration chain is correct.
The mismatch between HEAD file and the actual db migration head
happened in VPNaaS repo and it is useful to check this in pep8.

Depends-On: Ie4d20f5119018ffdebe2929b961c5ddb314ed734
Change-Id: I45e1e5b1cb3db94c138ee0911de5085c815db959

commit_message:
Add port type on port option

According to http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.config/cfg.html
oslo.config can use portType to support the ability to set valid range
on port option values

Closes-Bug: #1488861

Change-Id: Ic4310532f4155ade1706f0bca8df9466665aea97

commit_message:
Fixes matching issue build.py

And issue would occur when the namespace contained a partial amount
of the base distro's name causing the base and data images to assume
they had parent images in Kolla instead of setting thier parent to
None

Change-Id: I3b39a3e232c3faa77ee78d1ebb26b7da17bd4df4
Closes-Bug: #1489021

commit_message:
[MU 6.1] Corrects the restart command for Keystone

This patch changes the restart command for Keystone on Ubuntu
(from initctl restart openstack-keystone to initctl restart keystone)
in the 'backend_argument containing a password leaked in logs' update
section.

Change-Id: If6f04043e90f39f15a4c414ecf18aa043c359adb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/38/217638/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Unify Centos and Ubuntu Source Install - Glance

A change merged in the base allows for Centos and Ubuntu to install
all python things to the same locations. This updates the source
section to reflect that change.

Change-Id: Icc6c4ab8dee644a297f7a75b734466e617e0ee30
Partially-Implements: blueprint install-from-ubuntu

commit_message:
Rudimentary support for influxdb in devstack plugin

This is bare bones and gets the job done without too much
complexity. It relies, for the time being, on the influxdb
distributors not changing their paths and us keeping those paths up
to date.

The packages provided by influxdb are used because the packags from
the distros are currently too old. Because we are using these weird
packages, the service start and stop handling for influxdb is a bit
strange. When the distros are up to date, the _gnocchi_install_influxdb
function should be updated.

Note that influxdb is running _without_ access control.

Closes-Bug: #1481830
Change-Id: If5b3f05c9e4044efd2a5e4c5b7231d0b5856d9ca

commit_message:
Split option discovery function by middleware

Create separate option discovery functions for each piece of middleware,
so an application that only uses one piece can include only those
options in its sample configuration file.

Test the results with some unit tests that simply ensure the functions
do not raise exceptions, and by adding configuration options to the
documentation for the library, using the new integration of oslo.config
with sphinx.

Change-Id: I4c777cd70c063441f430c48ab1f9c9cac2c1fc75
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.middleware refs/changes/16/217316/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import itertools """Return a list of oslo.config options for ALL of the middleware classes. The returned list includes all oslo.config options which may be registered at runtime by the library. Each element of the list is a tuple. The first element is the name of the group under which the list of elements in the second element will be registered. A group name of None corresponds to the [DEFAULT] group in config files. This function is also discoverable via the 'oslo.concurrency' entry point under the 'oslo.config.opts' namespace. The purpose of this is to allow tools like the Oslo sample config file generator to discover the options exposed to users by this library. :returns: a list of (group_name, opts) tuples """ return list( itertools.chain( list_opts_sizelimit(), list_opts_ssl(), list_opts_cors(), ) ) def list_opts_sizelimit(): """Return a list of oslo.config options for the sizelimit middleware. ('oslo_middleware', copy.deepcopy(sizelimit._opts)), ] def list_opts_ssl(): """Return a list of oslo.config options for the sizelimit middleware. The returned list includes all oslo.config options which may be registered at runtime by the library. Each element of the list is a tuple. The first element is the name of the group under which the list of elements in the second element will be registered. A group name of None corresponds to the [DEFAULT] group in config files. This function is also discoverable via the 'oslo.concurrency' entry point under the 'oslo.config.opts' namespace. The purpose of this is to allow tools like the Oslo sample config file generator to discover the options exposed to users by this library. :returns: a list of (group_name, opts) tuples """ return [ ('oslo_middleware', copy.deepcopy(ssl.OPTS)), ] def list_opts_cors(): """Return a list of oslo.config options for the cors middleware. The returned list includes all oslo.config options which may be registered at runtime by the library. Each element of the list is a tuple. The first element is the name of the group under which the list of elements in the second element will be registered. A group name of None corresponds to the [DEFAULT] group in config files. This function is also discoverable via the 'oslo.concurrency' entry point under the 'oslo.config.opts' namespace. The purpose of this is to allow tools like the Oslo sample config file generator to discover the options exposed to users by this library. :returns: a list of (group_name, opts) tuples """ return [

commit_message:
Cleaning up the Transfer Table

This patch cleaned the transfer-table code and moved the tooltip logic out.
This will make it easier to later add the cloning feature in the bp below.

Change-Id: I6d4cb292a4b86abbf453843ba8b96c3b4a6cfa24
Partially-Implements: blueprint transfer-table-clone-feature

subject: Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-08-26 15:00:55.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/tempurl.py', 'test/functional/tests.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_tempurl.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/410778b86a49702f80b734bdbf2480b86db342e2', 'message': 'Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8
'}]
commit_message:
Disallow unsafe tempurl operations to point to unauthorized data

Do not allow PUT tempurls to create pointers to other data. Specifically
disallow the creation of DLO object manifests by returning an error if a
non-safe tempurl request includes an X-Object-Manifest header regardless of
the value of the header.

This prevents discoverability attacks which can use any PUT tempurl to probe
for private data by creating a DLO object manifest and then using the PUT
tempurl to head the object which would 404 if the prefix does not match any
object data or form a valid DLO HEAD response if it does.

This also prevents a tricky and potentially unexpected consequence of PUT
tempurls which would make it unsafe to allow a user to download objects
created by tempurl (even if they just created them) because the result of
reading the object created via tempurl may not be the data which was uploaded.

[CVE-2015-5223]

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>

Closes-Bug: 1453948

Change-Id: I91161dfb0f089c3990aca1b4255b520299ef73c8

commit_message:
Marking the login_url option as "deprecated_for_removal"

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/212239 has been successfully
merged and now we don't need the login_url option because only
the dashboard_url option is used in the dashboard test. This patch
is intended to mark CONF.dashboard.login_url as deprecated_for_removal.

Change-Id: I4195478d93da605218fddf9aa896e2804ab442ac

commit_message:
Add new deploy driver for diskless nodes

Introduce a new deploy driver for diskless nodes with
iSCSI and nfs support.

Change-Id: I7c04dc5336fa898f1f4f5fec1ee0e73abf0f02bd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic-specs refs/changes/74/181074/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ================================================== Deploy driver for diskless nodes ================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/diskless-nodes-driver This blueprint proposes new deploy driver for diskless nodes with root FS on network device. Driver will not deploy FS to the network storage, it prepares boot configuration and does power cycles. Problem description =================== There is not diskless nodes (hardware without local storage) support in Ironic. Typical boot order for diskless nodes with Linux OS: * Node loads kernel and initial ramdisk via PXE. * Initial ramdisk does mounting root FS from network device with pre-configured parameters. * Continue booting with normal OS init process. There are two types of access to network storage: * Via network block device (iSCSI, AoE, RBD). * Via exported network filesystem (nfs, CIFS). Most popular and well supported in distributives are iSCSI and nfs netboot mechanisms. Proposed change =============== A deploy driver for diskless nodes should be implemented. This driver should support root FS on iSCSI or nfs storage. Note: driver does not populate data to network storage devices, pre-configured FS on such device is required for a node. Linux distributives support passing parameters for root FS on network via kernel command line, and driver should use this method. Deploy process for a diskless node with proposed driver is simple: #. Ironic prepares PXE config for a node with provided parameters. #. Ironic sets boot from PXE and does power cycle for a node. #. Node boots into instance with root FS on network device. Because initial ramdisk parameter names for iSCSI are distro-specific we need at least two templates (for Redhat and Ubuntu). Alternatives ------------ Usage of hardware with local storage. Implements mentioned changes in existing PXE driver. Data model impact ----------------- None State Machine Impact -------------------- None REST API impact --------------- None RPC API impact -------------- None Driver API impact ----------------- None Nova driver impact ------------------ In the future Nova can pass iSCSI parameters of network storages to Ironic, but this changes is blocked now because Cinder does not have required features. Security impact --------------- Network device credentials stored in PXE config as plain text. It is recommended to use networks isolation and/or filtering for prevent unauthorized access to the storage device. Other end user impact --------------------- User must populate properly configured root FS to the network storage. Scalability impact ------------------ Owerall network performance can falling if there are many diskless nodes in the network. Performance Impact ------------------ Diskless node generates more network traffic than a node with local storage. Slower OS performance on the diskless node is possible as a result. Other deployer impact --------------------- The driver uses following driver_info fields: * dskls_storage: Type of storage, iscsi or nfs. Required. * dskls_kernel: Glance UUID or link to instance kernel. Required. * dskls_ramdisk: Glance UUID or link to instance initrd. Required. Parameters for nfs: * dskls_address: IP address of the NFS server. Required. * dskls_root: Name of the directory on the NFS server to mount as root. Required. * dskls_options: Additional NFS options. Optional. Parameters for iscsi: * dskls_os: Type of distributive, redhat or ubuntu. Required. * dskls_initiator: Name of iSCSI initiator. Required. * dskls_target: Name of iSCSI target. Required. * dskls_address: IP address of the iSCSI target. Required. * dskls_port: iSCSI port. Optional. Administrator must configure access from node to the storage. Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: yuriyz Work Items ---------- * Implement a driver. * Implement unit tests coverage. Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit tests will be implemented. Upgrades and Backwards Compatibility ==================================== None Documentation Impact ==================== Will document the usage of this driver. References ========== * https://help.ubuntu.com/community/DisklessUbuntuHowto * https://www.kernel.org/doc/Documentation/filesystems/nfs/nfsroot.txt * http://it-joe.com/howtos/iscsi.php

This test class only fails with no tenant isolation in the gate. The only
reason I can think of for this is that the non-isolated demo tenant has

commit_message:
Avoid default quota limit of 10 subnets

This test class only fails with no tenant isolation in the gate. The only
reason I can think of for this is that the non-isolated demo tenant has
an extra subnet created by devstack whereas the isolated tenant for this
test class does not. I tried putting addCleanups for the network and subnets
in the for loop but that caused other strange problems.

Change-Id: Ib86d54ee4cf317bb9d93d28fd62f44d738b5efaa

commit_message:
Add support for docker-compose

At pyconau's sprints, I took some time to play with docker-compose and
get Zaqar running in it. These 2 files are everything we need to make
that happen.

The composition is based on 2 images. The first one is the mongodb one,
which is downloaded from DockerHub. The second one is built out of
Zaqar's code.

Look at the `README` for the exact steps to use this.

Change-Id: Ia2ff8dc90f6a4ed669e749fed036a8f88c8627a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/15/208315/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Running Zaqar with docker-compose --------------------------------- #. Create the image:: $ docker-compose build #. Create a config file and set the database uri's to `mongodb://db:27017/zaqar` as shown in the previous session:: #. Set the bind address to `0.0.0.0`:: bind = 0.0.0.0 #. Start the container:: $ docker-compose up

commit_message:
Remove pypy's check for Zaqar

Zaqar's team has not been focusing on pypy support for at least 2
cycles. Keeping the check jobs around is not necessary and the checks
are non-voting anyway.

Change-Id: Icf412647c6b51c5bfb58968627698eb7d3087c3a

commit_message:
Add an experimental influxdb storage job for gnocchi

The gate-gnocchi-dsvm-functional-* jobs take a storage backend and an
indexer backend as templated values. This change adds an
experimental job using influxdb as the storage backend and mysql as
the indexer.

Depends-On: If5b3f05c9e4044efd2a5e4c5b7231d0b5856d9ca.
Change-Id: I23bd9717dc5c40292fa40ad1ac3b28f4bbc2401c

commit_message:
Exclude gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-pxe_ipa.* from stable/juno

The code that this tests wasn't added until Kilo as part of
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/ironic/+spec/ipa-as-default-ramdisk
so it doesn't make sense to test on Juno.

Change-Id: Id9af33cf85ca519f63e5a248384060736386c20c

commit_message:
Make nodepool dsvm job voting

This test is running reliably now and it is mostly self testing (the
plugin and post devstack run checks are all in the nodepool repo). Make
it voting and gate on it to keep it reliable.

commit_message:
Really add common exclusion for manuals repos

*/source/common/* will only match one path element either side, so
we need to open the glob a little wider to match correctly. It also
appears that the other manuals repos also have source/common as a
symlink, so remove the openstack-manuals guard.

Change-Id: Id6e883ec388d9d5f6d471fa8b23f8e3f2ed1885a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/60/217560/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: EXCLUDE='.*/**,**/source/common/**' -v master --srcdir . --txdir . $ZANATA_RULES -e "$EXCLUDE" \
deleted_lines: EXCLUDE='.*/**' if [ "$project" = "openstack-manuals" ]; then EXCLUDE='.*/**,*/source/common/*' fi -v master --srcdir . --txdir . $ZANATA_RULES -e $EXCLUDE \

commit_message:
Add a simple description check for gerrit/projects.yaml

Add a very simple check for some common typos that might appear in the
descriptions.

Correct existing typos as found by the check

Change-Id: I6edd833de8544e44750c3a3fb49a065f99a18499
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/63/217463/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import re # *very* simple check for common description mistakes badwords = ( # (words), what_words_should_be (('openstack', 'Openstack', 'Open Stack'), 'OpenStack'), (('Devstack', 'devstack'), 'DevStack') ) if description: for words, should_be in badwords: for word in words: # look for the bad word hanging out on it's own. Only # trick is "\b" doesn't consider "-" or '.' as a # word-boundary, so ignore it if it looks like some # sort of job-description (e.g. "foo-devstack-bar") or # a url ("foo.openstack.org") if re.search(r'(?<![-.])\b%s\b' % word, description): print "Error: %s: should be %s" % (description, should_be) found_errors += 1

commit_message:
Create logstash-filters project

A standalone project to hold logstash filters.  OpenStack
infra and operators can collaborate here.

commit_message:
Renaming & moving Manila-HDFS jobs to check pipeline

This patch renames manila-hdfs job names and moves from
Manila's experimental to check pipeline.

Also this patch modifies job definitions to point to appropriate
pre_, post_ test_hook.sh files.

Change-Id: Ib14c57fa986b9696c86d0b38c19faf8e23cf9920

commit_message:
Add more logs to rabbitmq get_status function

It's really hard to debug, when get_status() returns $OCF_NOT_RUNNING
only and looses exit code and error output.

Added more logs to avoid of this situation.

Related-Bug: #1488999

Change-Id: Id0999235d7be688f55799e2952fe22e97b678ce7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/88/217288/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ocf_log err "get_status() failed with code ${rc}. Command output: ${body}"

commit_message:
Change DEBUG log in loopingcall to TRACE level log

The DEBUG log message in _run_loop() method will record every
loopingcall info every interval, that may cause log noise. e.g. In
ceilometer, the partition coordinator will have a fixed interval looping
call every two seconds as default.

Change-Id: I32aa474ece2458aa7cc1a5c271a40f664bf07af2

commit_message:
allow to pass more params to 'horizon::wsgi::apache'

 * new params are: wsgi_processes, wsgi_threads
   priority, vhost_conf_name, vhost_ssl_conf_nameq
 * remove vhost_extra_params from deprecated

Change-Id: I0d919768960c75cec58b7c87f60a665b7fb2877e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/56/209256/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: context 'with overriding wsgi parameters' do before do params.merge!({ :listen_ssl => true, :servername => 'some.host.tld', :horizon_cert => '/etc/pki/tls/certs/httpd.crt', :horizon_key => '/etc/pki/tls/private/httpd.key', :horizon_ca => '/etc/pki/tls/certs/ca.crt', :wsgi_processes => '5', :wsgi_threads => '11', :priority => '12', :vhost_conf_name => 'horizon_vhost_conf_name', :vhost_ssl_conf_name => 'horizon_ssl_vhost', }) end it 'configures apache' do is_expected.to contain_class('horizon::wsgi::apache').with({ :bind_address => nil, :listen_ssl => true, :servername => 'some.host.tld', :horizon_cert => '/etc/pki/tls/certs/httpd.crt', :horizon_key => '/etc/pki/tls/private/httpd.key', :horizon_ca => '/etc/pki/tls/certs/ca.crt', :wsgi_processes => '5', :wsgi_threads => '11', :priority => '12', :vhost_conf_name => 'horizon_vhost_conf_name', :vhost_ssl_conf_name => 'horizon_ssl_vhost', }) end end

commit_message:
Use restorecon over chcon for unbound selinux

Rather then explicitly forcing a security context for unbound, we
should restore the default selinux contexts defined by the OS.

Change-Id: I4bb21dcbbcbcff6a5458ebf9478f58d95ad7240a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/project-config refs/changes/03/211703/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: # HPCloud has selinux enabled by default, Rackspace apparently not. # Regardless, apply the correct context. if [ -x /sbin/restorecon ] ; then chcon system_u:object_r:named_conf_t:s0 /etc/unbound/forwarding.conf fi

commit_message:
Remove extra pyhon-jobs from networking-ofagent

Change Ie060ac825bbb9a643240390c635c22f5cc01776d intented to move
python-jobs template as invidual jobs since python27 is non-voting but
forgot to remove the template itself - and forgot to add
networking-ofagent-branch-tarball. Do both changes now to really
remove non-voting python27 job from gate queue.

Change-Id: I6319b7abd2e26ab6c39ae9ef82009bf81045718d

commit_message:
Remove unneeded neutron services in dsvm-neutron

This job breaks when attempting to start neutron due to issues with the
vpn service. Nodepool does not need the vpn service or the fwaas service
so just remove them.

Change-Id: Iaf010a021f096731cb757155ceb0afcf2830c301
